New Records: Shakib Al Hasan became the sixth Asian batter to complete 2,500 runs in T20I cricket.
Shakib Al Hasan set a new T20I record for Bangladesh, becoming the country's first batter to score more than 2,500 runs in men's T20Is.
Key Match Events: Shakib Al Hasan hit an unbeaten 64 against the Netherlands.
Shakib Al Hasan's first fifty in international cricket since October 2022.
Bangladesh posted 159 in their quota of 20 overs in Kingstown.
Tanzid Hasan scored 35 off 26 balls, hitting 5 boundaries and a six.
Shakib Al Hasan and Tanzid Hasan added 48 runs for the third wicket.
Shakib Al Hasan stitched a 41-run partnership with Mahmadullah, who hit 21-ball 25.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh got off to a poor start after Netherlands won the toss and opted to bowl.
Bangladesh were hoping for a positive result in their crunch match as they suffered a heartbreaking 4-run defeat to South Africa, days after beating Sri Lanka in their opener.
